Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no evidence suggesting that the novel coronavirus can be spread through fruits and vegetables.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the risk of virus transmission through fruits and vegetables by stating that the virus remains viable on them for 12 hours.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not providing enough support or evidence to back up its statement.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to prove that the virus can be spread through fruits and vegetables.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the virus is spreading faster in the West than in Asia due to the consumption of fruits and vegetables.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not present any alternative explanations for the spread of the virus.
